visualization_prompt: Generate a pie chart showing proportional distribution of Earth's water supply using categorical percentage breakdown with accessibility-compliant labeling
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains three categorical variables representing Earth's hydrospheric composition. Percentage values (Salt water: 97%, Ice: 2%, Fresh water: 1%) derive from established geophysical measurements, requiring no synthetic generation. The pie chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating gridlines and using direct percentage labels, following Tufte's principles. Color contrast between marine (#7CB5EC) and freshwater (#10487F) components adheres to Cairo's perceptual discriminability standards. The exploded fresh water slice emphasizes its ecological significance despite small proportional value. Legend positioning and percentage formatting (+/- 0% variance from source data) maintain visual clarity while preserving scientific accuracy.
